symc.name: SW_FORCEMINIMIZE
symc.desc: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

symc.name: SW_HIDE
symc.desc: Hides the window and activates another window

symc.name: SW_MINIMIZE
symc.desc: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order

symc.name: SW_SHOW
symc.desc: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position

symc.name: SW_SHOWDEFAULT
symc.desc: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

symc.name: SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED
symc.desc: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

symc.name: SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
symc.desc: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

symc.name: SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE
symc.desc: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, except the window is not activated.

symc.name: SW_SHOWNA
symc.desc: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except that the window is not activated.

symc.name: SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE
symc.desc: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOWNORMAL, except that the window is not activated.

symc.name: SW_SHOWNORMAL
symc.desc: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.
